column1: #China reported 17 more cases of pneumonia caused by a new coronavirus strain on Sunday. Three of the patients are seriously ill, said the Wuhan Municipal Heath Commission.
Chinese pharmaceutical companies rallied after the central city of #Wuhan reported one more death linked to the newly discovered strain of coronavirus. pic.twitter.com/OT2lmZeMu3
#China had confirmed 40171 #coronavirus cases by the end of Feb. 9 and the death toll had risen to 908, said the National Health Commission.

#Chinaâ€™s #Hubei province, the epicenter of the #coronavirus outbreak, reported 56 new deaths on Sunday, bringing the total to 350, local health commission said Monday. 
It confirmed 2103 new cases of infection, bringing the total to 11177 by the end of the day.

The number of deaths in #Hubei province, the epicenter of the #coronavirus outbreak, rose by 94 to 1068 as of Tue, local health commission said. 

A further 1,638 new cases were detected in Hubei, taking the total number of confirmed cases in the province to 33,366.

#Hubei province, the epicenter of the #coronavirus outbreak, had 349 new confirmed cases on Wed, down from 1693 a day earlier and the lowest since Jan. 25. 

That brings the total number of confirmed cases in Hubei to 62,031.

Death toll in Hubei reached 2029, up by 108.

The number of deaths in #Hubei, the epicenter of the #coronavirus outbreak, rose by 132 to 1921 as of Tue, said local health commission.
A further 1693 cases were detected, the lowest since Feb 11 and the 2nd straight day below 2,000, taking the total in the province to 61,682.

The number of deaths from #coronavirus in #Hubei, the epicenter of the epidemic, rose by 93 to 1789 as of Monday, the local health commission said.

A further 1807 cases were detected, taking the total in the province to 59,989.
